content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-16-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Knowing prevention in subsequent pregnancies |Description=None |Rubric=Management |Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle |Order=16}} There is a risk of recurrence if the patient has a history of pregnancy-induced hypertension in a similar or different way (vascular-placental pathologies = pre-eclampsia, IUGR, HRP, MFIU) in around 1 in 5 patients. You will need : - any "preconception consultation" (to adapt antihypertensive treatment, check that there are no contraindications and organise coordinated follow-up) +/- direct follow-up in a suitable maternity unit - stop smoking'' etc... [[Prevention of tobacco-related risks SD-314]] - preventive treatment with low-dose aspirin: 75 to 160 mg/d in the evening before 16 and up to 35 weeks' gestation (only in cases of a history of severe IUGR or early and/or severe pre-eclampsia with induced preterm birth). question.title: What is the primary recommendation for a patient with a history of pregnancy-induced hypertension?
question.description: A patient with a history of pregnancy-induced hypertension, what should be done to reduce the risk of recurrence?

option_a.title: Continue with current antihypertensive treatment and monitor closely
option_a.description: The patient should continue their current antihypertensive treatment and be monitored closely for any signs of complications

option_b.title: Stop smoking and take low-dose aspirin
option_b.description: The patient should stop smoking and take low-dose aspirin to reduce the risk of recurrence

option_c.title: Undergo regular check-ups and avoid high-impact exercises
option_c.description: The patient should undergo regular check-ups and avoid high-impact exercises to reduce the risk of complications

option_d.title: Consider preventive treatment with low-dose aspirin
option_d.description: The patient may consider preventive treatment with low-dose aspirin to reduce the risk of recurrence

correct_option.title: Consider preventive treatment with low-dose aspirin
correct_option.description: Only this option mentions preventive treatment with low-dose aspirin as a recommended action
